content.description: Plate Tectonics ascends a very enjoyable crack/flake at a low angle. It could use a little cleaning but was climbed through the lichen.
content.location: On the left side of face by the vernal pool, it climbs an obvious flake.

climbs.name: Waist Deep in a Mud Puddle
climbs.fa: Wes P the crimpdaddy DK pantsless from a squat

content.description: Sit start the right-leaning arete. Originally done as a squat but do the sit for sill value  Don’t take the wrong gully on the approach and try to cut over. You may end up, waist deep in a mud puddle.
content.location: It is on the same boulder as Key to the Attic ascending the only right-leaning, slightly overhung, sloper arete.

content.description: Sit start the right arete. An awkward sit leads to good arete holds and an easy topout.
content.location: This is on a boulder just past Plate Tectonics. If you find Nightcrawler, follow the gully to the vernal pool.

content.description: This is a boulder situated directly next to a small 20 by 20 vernal pool. Another boulder sits just off the pool as well.
